Variable Declarations

let and const are two new type of variable declaration in typescript.

  • let - similar to var but allow developer to avoid some "mistakes" that user run into JavaScript
  • const - augmentation of let in that it prevents re-assignments to a variable.

Problems with var variable-declarations

  • scoping of the variables is confusing(example 1).
  • variable capturing (example 2).
